discussion.content:
C. https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/custom-skills/use-a-dialog-model-to-manage-ambiguous-responses.html

Alexa: I've saved your trip. Do you want to create another trip? (Since the previous dialog was complete, the user's response to this question is outside the dialog and not related to the PlanMyTrip intent.)

User: Yes. (Since the user is not within a dialog at this point, this response invokes AMAZON.YesIntent.)

Skill handles AMAZON.YesIntent appropriately…

questions.question_text:
An Amazon Alexa trip planner skill has several intents and slots. One of the intents is PlanMyTripIntent and some of the slots are fromCity, toCity, departDate, and returnDate. The following is a sample dialog:
User: Ask plan my trip to start a new trip leaving from Seattle.
Alexa: You said you are leaving from Seattle, right?

User: Yes -
Alexa: I've saved your trip. Do you want to create another trip?

User: Yes -
What will be invoked upon the user's final "Yes"?

comments.content: Does that mean B is correct?

discussion.content:
Same reference link as given, but why not D. http://alexaskillstutorials.com/

Supported Language
Add supported language to product
Click on the “+ Add new language” link to add a new language for this product. In its place, a menu will pop open to reveal what languages you can support. Because our tutorial skill is simple, we will only be able to select the English (US) option.

choices.B: Change the locale in the Alexa Simulator tab in the developer console
choices.C: Change the AWS Lambda function to include the correct locale in the Connections.SendRequest directive
choices.A: Change the release date and redeploy the product
choices.D: Change the language in the premium content

questions.question_text:
An Alexa Skill Builder wants to implement in-skill purchasing to offer one-time purchases for access to premium content. The Builder created an entitlement product and deployed it successfully using the ASK CLI tool. When testing the custom BuyInskillProductIntent in the developer console, the Builder receives the following error:
Sorry, this product is not available with your current language setting.
How can this error be fixed?

An Alexa Skill Builder made changes to an AWS Lambda function that is used as the endpoint for a skill. The Builder discovers that the skill now returns an error when it is launched.
How can the Builder use the Lambda console to trigger the function and debug the code?

choices.D: Create a Lambda test event using the JSON interaction model to find the specific error within the code.
choices.B: Create a Lambda test event using the JSON response as output to find the specific error within the code.
choices.C: Check the JSON response to see if there are any syntax errors in the code.
choices.A: Create a Lambda test event using the JSON request as input to find the specific error within the code.

questions.question_text:
An Alexa Skill Builder has created a taxi hiring skill. The skill needs to find out when the customer wants a taxi, where the customer is traveling from, and where the customer wants to go. The Builder is currently asking each question individually, in the following order:
"Where do you want to take a taxi from"
"Where do you want to take a taxi to"
"When do you need a taxi"
To ensure the voice interaction is flexible, how should this information be gathered regardless of the order in which the user provides it?

choices.C: Create three intents with one slot each. Use Dialog.ElicitSlot to fill the slots.
choices.B: Create an intent for each question and include slots for each piece of information on every intent
choices.D: Create a single intent with three slots. Use the Dialog.Delegate directive to fill the slots.
choices.A: Use a single intent and slot. Inspect the incoming slot value and categorize then response, then prompt for the remaining information.

choices.E: The beta skill history in the Amazon Alexa app will disappear once the beta test has ended
choices.D: The beta tester will lose access to the beta skill but will maintain access to the live skill
choices.A: The beta tester will lose access to the beta skill and will need to reenable the live skill
choices.C: The administrator will receive an email confirming that the beta tester has been removed
choices.B: The beta tester will receive an email saying the beta test has ended

questions.question_text: Which of the following occur when a beta test of a live skill times out? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The answers are A and B.

https://developer.amazon.com/en-US/docs/alexa/custom-skills/skills-beta-testing-for-alexa-skills.html

exam.name: AWS Certified Alexa Skill Builder - Specialty
